channel.title: Sound Engine - rate the quality
channel.description:
I have been working on a small sound engine written in Java. The engine (right now) has absolutely no GUI and takes all pattern, timing, SPC file to load from a txt file currently. This was mearly a text to get how well the engine could mashup the sounds right now. I just put in random values and got an outcome. This engine is FAR from done so please do [b]not[/b] ask for sample code or anything.
Anyways, without further dissapointment. I present to you a link to the sound. I don't think it was all that bad for just writing in random values. http://tinypic.com/player.php?v=23i6t04&s=7
I got my SPC file from: http://mikrosonic.com/spc-scenes/

This

Good Job, sound’s good. (:

Hope to see some progress.[/quote]
As soon as I get the components programmed and a simple GUI made I will post a development thread.

item.title: Sound Engine - rate the quality
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I can’t use it right now due to being in a public place, but I am definitely gonna look into this later. I’ve been really interested in studying instrumentation synthesizing and sampling and such, but it has always been an elusively difficult subject for me. I wish you the best of luck with this project.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xryz wrote:

I didn’t think the quality was bad, but then again i dont really have any samples(good and/or bad) to compare it to.

item.title: Sound Engine - rate the quality
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Thanks, over the next few days I will be getting the timing issues down. Not sure if anybody noticed the beginning is a bit off. As well as some things cut out early. This was not a error in my txt file as I don’t have sound stopping written in yet. It is supposed to play that whole simple then stop.

Anyways how’s the quality of its output? I have shitty earphones or I would be able to tell if it was good or bad.

Read full topic
